38696004.review:
这是一个测量欧洲血统的游戏。
经常有老铁问我，“小木木啊，你说我们是谁，我们从哪里来，又要到哪里去？”
我反手就是一巴掌，“笨蛋，我们就是为了开箱而生的！”
讲个笑话，以下开始正经评测。
初见这游戏，你可能因为它的低画质而叹息，因为它的过于简单而鄙视。但是小木木我负责任的告诉你，这是一款非常有内涵的游戏。
前段时间，“开箱是否算赌博”这一话题引起游戏界广泛议论，各国，各厂商态度不一。有认为这是毒品的，有习以为常的。。。。
而在我们的日常游戏中，开箱也是让人哭笑不得的一个话题。从游戏中各种卡牌游戏的开包、抽人物到各种游戏皮肤再到各种武器箱子再到现实中的撕方便面roll游戏甚至彩票赌博，贵的贱的，可交易的不可交易的，可以说是五花八门了。在开箱过程中，有无氪抽到ssr一发入魂的欧皇，也有花钱都抽不到好东西的非囚（此处并非错别字），有开箱子出刀发家致富的，也有开出一大堆垃圾枪血本无归的，开箱似乎已经成为我们日常生活中习以为常又不可或缺的一部分。商人们用尽心机，使用各种各样的手法吸引玩家投入开箱“大业”，赚了个痛快。
为什么开箱“方兴未艾”？
单个开箱价格的相对低廉，大众媒体的“故意”报道，对自己欧洲血统的盲目自信，对不劳而获的妄想，对已知事物中未知成分的狂热。。。
开箱最终结果为何？
在公正公开的前提下，总体而言，庄家永远赚的最多，下家之和永远赔本。

此游戏用开各种物品（从垃圾桶到箱子到小火箭到龙珠。。。）的形式模拟开箱，箱子有不同价格，赚钱可通过玩一个贪吃蛇小游戏或者卖掉开箱获得的物品获得，每种价格的箱子已经开出的物品都可以在装备栏查看并装备上（收集系统），右上角还有累计开箱次数，可以说的上麻雀虽小五脏俱全了。
3个亮点：
1、价格便宜、系统简单易理解，有中文（就冲这不来波好评？）。
2、开出不同物品时游戏内部发出不同笑声bgm，讽刺了人们在开箱中大喜大悲的情绪状态。
3、贪吃蛇小游戏配合rpg大作一般的背景让人欲罢不能。。

对于开箱之评论，众说纷纭，在此我们无法也不能简单用善恶对错来衡量。但对于这款游戏，无论你是开箱的支持者还是批评者，相信你都能找到属于自己的那份乐趣/感悟。
                                                                                                                                 萌新小木木敬上

38506340.review:
So after 2ish hours I broke this game, I now have more money than I can use, and likely will never lose it all until I prestige (which is now an option). 

But i paid 1 dollar for it.  You know what?  It's a pretty good title, it combines the idea of the loot box, with a parody of it, and honestly, a hell of a lot more thought and care went into this title than you might think.  

The entire "game" is a loot box simulator, open the boxes, and sell items you don't want or already own, and then open another, with a real game (called "Not BFII" for a reference to Battlefield 2) which has multiple stages unlocked when you get to the next tier, and each stage gives you a decent amount of money for good play.  You might have to play multiple times but the grind isn't that bad here. 

However for Collectors, the grind is real, to get every item in the loot boxes you have to keep opening them to get that rare or legendary item, which... yeah that's the point of the game to some extent. 

But there's an excitement when you open the box, and a good feeling when you get something new.  It'd be easy to call this a simple parody, and while it is, it also captures the loot box experience, the excitement and ... you know what, for a buck it's just not that bad a game. 

I recommend it as long as people know it's a "joke game" it has better production values than most joke games, but this isn't a deep experience, but it is enjoyable in an odd way.

Great game! A shame there are lootboxes, but at least they are [i]Purely Cosmetic[/i]™

Also, while you're here, let me read to you a brief summary of one of my favorite movies - Blade Runner.
"In the futuristic year of 2019, Los Angeles has become a dark and depressing metropolis, filled with urban decay. Rick Deckard, an ex-cop, is a "Blade Runner". Blade runners are people assigned to assassinate "replicants". The replicants are androids that look like real human beings. When four replicants commit a bloody mutiny on the Off World colony, Deckard is called out of retirement to track down the androids. As he tracks the replicants, eliminating them one by one, he soon comes across another replicant, Rachel, who evokes human emotion, despite the fact that she's a replicant herself. As Deckard closes in on the leader of the replicant group, his true hatred toward artificial intelligence makes him question his own identity in this future world, including what's human and what's not human."
-blazesnakes9, IMDB

Blade Runner 2049, the sequel to Blade Runner, was pretty good too. Easily the most beautiful film from Denis Villeneuve, the man who also directed Arrival (2016), Sicario (2015), Enemy (2013), and Prisoners (2013). I thought the performances were good, Ryan Gosling and Harrison Ford are definitely the stars of the show. I was originally concerned when I heard Jared Leto was playing the role as the antagonist, and while I would've liked to see him on screen more, he played the role well enough.

Another film I really like this year is Baby Driver, from Edgar Wright, the man behind Shaun of the Dead, Hot Fuzz, The World's End, and the underrated Scott Pilgrim vs. the World, featuring Michael Cera. "What's the address for Amazon dot ca?", Scott asked. "Amazon.ca.", replied his homosexual roommate, Wallace. Ah, that film is just a classic.

Baby Driver, right, It's a crime film focused around a getaway driver named 'Baby', that's B-A-B-Y. His last name is NOT Driver, as I later found out. Yes, I was disappointed too. Anyway, the whole film is set to the beat of a variety of rock music, and the editing is nothing shy of perfect. This film just oozes style, from the cinematography, to the soundtrack, the fantastic editing, and the performances from Ansel Elgort as Baby, Lily James as the love interest Deborah, Jon Hamm, Jamie Foxx, and Kevin Spacey. Just a great, fun film.

Blade Runner 2049 and Baby Driver are my two favorite films this year.
And 'I Can't Believe It's Not Gambling' is alright, for $1 you really can't go wrong.

38369634.review:
[h1]We must imagine Sisyphus happy[/h1]

Far better than it should be for its price, this game offers a repetitive mechanic with randomized rewards which are merely cosmetic. Experience the thrill of not gambling for a fraction of the price, then get duplicates so you have to re-roll. 38365468.review:
As lootbox simulators go, this one is definitely above par and in some ways has completely perfected the lootbox genre - no wonder it was considered GOTY. Starting with lootboxes that are actual trash, you work your way up the hierarchy of boxes to obtain better and better in game items, and consequentially better and better boxes of loot. I enjoyed how items looked like low quality jpegs of things that are box-like in nature. These items can be equiped by the player and it is refreshing that any number of items can be equiped and they don't seem to affect gameplay OR aesthetics (unlike so many lootbox simulators where the items obtained drastically affect the aesthetics of the player character!)

One huge criticism of the game is that lootboxes never contained additional lootboxes. I don't know how companies can still be getting away with this in 2017 - if you're going to sell lootboxes, some of those lootboxes better contain other boxes that contain loot but also have an additional probability of yet more boxes.

An unusual positive in this lootbox simulator - it contains a small video game for those who aren't in it simply for the thrill of the box or get too tired of winning. The video game resemblies the classic game Snake, except that instead of a snake you are a dolphin and there are also portals in what is clearly a industry insider reference to the cult-classic, lootboxless failure Portal. Needless to say I stuck to opening my boxes.

38346258.review:
This is a "play pretty much the whole thing while in the holiday hold queue for customer service somewhere", simple little game. *Points to Played time* I think that's as much a comment on how long I was on hold as on the game. Anyhow, it is what it says on the tin: Lootboxes, sans game (and sans cash shop), and a simple minigame that gives far better currency returns than any cash shop game I ever played, modified at each new box-level.

It's a small thing and once you've played it, you've played it. But for under $1 US, it's a fitting parody of lootbox shenanigans. It's more likely to inspire a sarcastic snort than a laugh, I think, and is definitely more of a "do it while most of your attention is elsewhere" game than something I'd play with full attention, but I don't regret the purchase. 

That's partly because every time I see this game in my Steam list, I'll remember why I seldom bother anymore with the sort of games this exists to mock. That's a reminder well worth a dollar to me. But, there appears to have been more effort put into this than into some Steam games that expect to be taken seriously. (The creators of which expect them to be taken seriously. Y'know what I meant.)

The "build the game to drive players to the cash store with glitter and cattle prods" design trend has gotten very old, and deserves the poke in the eye with a shiny, lootbox-skinned stick that this little game gives it. So, thumbs up for that. And all flippancy aside, things like the name of the first tier of lootboxes may be cheap laughs (along with the previously mentioned sarcastic snorts), but I'll take 'em. I can use all the laughs I can get!

P.S. - No actual shiny sticks are to be found in this game at this time.

38345950.review: I Can't Believe It's Not Gambling

38345400.review:
This review will have 2 parts: joke review and serious review

First, the joke review (which is a not recommended):

Great game; it recreates the loot box controversy well.

HOWEVER; I cannot recommend it. Why? Because if this game wants to be a perfect satire, it has to cost $60. If it isn't $60 and has exploitative lootboxes it is meaningless.
11/10 GOTY IGN




And now my actual thoughts:
I Can't Believe It's Not Gambling (ICBING) is a satirical game about lootboxes in videogames and how ridiculous the increase of monetization of customers has been. The goal is to open lootboxes with a fake currency and collecting skins for your lootboxes. To earn more cash you have to play a snake clone called Not BF2 where you play as a whale collecting lootboxes (looks like it's pisstaking actual designs, I recognise the Overwatch one). Earning coins is easy enough with this minigame but when you're done you get to open more lootboxes. Which after a while becomes addictive. You open box after box, celebrate when you see a legendary colour dropping only to be disappointed when you get another damn repeat. Selling the skins makes up for a bit of the cost, but of course if you get common after common you'll have to resort to Not BF2 to earn more.

My main complaint is that the devs could have done a bit more with earning coins. To be a bit more realistic playing it could give next to nothing unless you grind like mad, and you could "pay" for more coins. A simple buy currency button that guilt trips you whenever you click it. Something like that. (and by a button I mean clicking it gives you coins without a enter card number interface at all)

However the best part about ICBING is that it might POSSIBLY be an exit drug should someone with a real gambling addiction gets into lootboxes. By buying the game that person might be able to use this to fulfil the urge while seeking help. Which is what it is at the end of the day. ICBING is hilarious, but it should be a reminder that publishers are attempting to get more dolla dolla bills by exploiting a common human weakness, and that is a major dick move. And shows that when the AAA games industry crashes, we should have no sympathy.

As for how good it is as a game, it's a dollar, and even though this game isn't winning any awards anytime soon, it's decent fun for that price.

Recommended.

38321990.review:
游戏来自于[url=steamcommunity.com/groups/theninthart]第九艺术研究组[/url]的牵线鉴赏家系统。

=====

[h1]“每当你在游戏中受挫，不要怀疑你自己，并不是你技术差劲，也不是和队友缺乏沟通，毫无疑问，只是你开箱不够多，因而没能用皮肤和坐骑震撼人心的特效震慑住对手。”一位风暴英雄玩家如是说。[/h1]

当你选择开箱，你就选择了一条最快变强的道路。谁不爱漂亮的皮肤呢？为了对得起手下角色的颜值，你总会用那些看起来漂亮的角色多玩几把，很快，你的技术就提高了。因而，所有玩家所要面对的第一个问题总是，如何才能开出心中想要的道具呢。

能开的箱子是有限的，而想要的皮肤却怎么都出不完。每当翻看商店里未拥有的皮肤时，心中总有一种无力的感觉。

[h1]“来玩这一款开箱模拟器吧，梦想远大的玩家，你的开箱愿望能得到无止尽的满足。”一个低沉的声音在你的耳边回响。[/h1]

在这里你可以忘记胜负,享受开箱。经过14小时的游玩，我爬到了全球排行榜的顶端。当然，我没有开满100000个箱子，也就自然没能全成就（游戏开发者自己也没有全成就。。。真是无语啊）。

[h1]游戏主要由两个部分组成，贪吃蛇小鲸鱼版本和开箱模拟器。[/h1]

当你没有钱去开箱的时候，你可以享受一下简陋但是有些趣味的贪吃鲸，通过Valve家的传送门让一堆奇怪的道具跟在你的身后。由于得分会在鲸鱼队伍一定长度时获得倍数加成，其实贪吃鲸游戏的盈利速率比单纯的开箱更快。不同等级开箱界面左下角的贪吃鲸的场景不相同，高级场景会比低一级场景盈利多9倍。

虽然开箱开出来的道具只有颜色的不同，而且不同等级的箱子除了开箱的价钱和收益逐级贵9倍，颜色和模型并没有特别多的变化。在所有箱子种类中，最低级的箱子反而是模型量最多的，给人一种后面的箱子只是为了延长游戏时间而设计的感觉。由于每一次开箱都要对四个物品选择卖出或者是收集，在多次游玩后会给人疲劳感，这时候玩一玩贪吃鲸真是一种对抓着鼠标的手的救赎。无论如何，模拟器里开箱系统在你有了一定的资本以后是可以永动开箱的，真是比别的游戏开箱良心多啦。（请看着我真诚的眼神）

尽管如此，我惊讶地发现只是看着开箱的动画我就能获得内心的宁静。这真是一种不可思议的体验（我觉得我中了开箱的毒）。总而言之，虽然这游戏有着这样那样的不足，如果你不是全成就强迫症，还有些开箱上瘾，这款售价6元的开箱模拟器不失为一种有效帮助你获得内心宁静的手段。

不说了，不说了，冬幕节到了，我去攒箱子去了。

[b] 总评5/10。[/b]

Getting bored, tired, or have responsibilities that are calling you away from the computer, such as work or romantic relationships? No problem, go ahead and close the game... but first open just a couple more lootboxes.

Dec 16 edit:

Today offered a new holiday update. I'll just copy-paste something I posted in a thread.

"I had gotten all the original-content items after 440 lootboxes. That's an average of ~60 lootboxes per "tier" to collect all the items from said tier. Not bad, a decent return on time-investment.

Now after the holiday update, 70 lootboxes I got one holiday item.
65 more lootboxes, one more holiday item.
And there's 8 holiday items per tier? Even being generous and saying you get a holiday item every 50 lootboxes, with no duplicates, that'd be 2800 to get all of them.

But it's taking me more than 50 per, and I assume duplicates are possible.
Yeah, no thanks.


This game was amusing and even somewhat entertaining in its original form; a parody of bad business practices in the videogame industry. With this holiday update, now it greatly reflects the games it sought to parody.. lots of time/effort required for ludicrously minimal reward.

Best of luck to anyone who actually wants to go the distance. But I'm out."

38303836.review:
I Can't Believe It's Not Gambling succeeds where games like DLC Quest failed. DLC Quest made a fun, but ultimately forgettable, game where buying things needed for progression was purchased in-game as joke DLC. The main problem was, that there was actually a competant game under the hood of DLC Quest. I Can't Believe It's Not Gambling isn't even really a game, despite it having an awful snake clone to get the in-game currency, and that's what makes it so good.

It took me over 100 boxes just to get all 37 items in first box category. It didn't sugar coat it and give a raising chance to get the missing items, it showed just how blantant of a rip-off these sorts of lootboxes are. That, to me, makes it an excellent parody of this system. It isn't fun, it isn't rewarding, and, much to the chagrin of EA, it doesn't give a sense of "Pride and Accomplishment" opening all of these boxes. What it is, is tedious. That's why despite liking what I Can't Believe It's Not Gambling does I don't actually recommend anyone buy it.

38294657.review:
[h1]Rating: N/A[/h1]
I am unable to give this game a proper rating as it shouldn't be treated as such. The game is 'bad', yet hilarious (well, not quite, but you get the idea).

[h1]Short Review:[/h1]
This game is NOT a "game". It's a protest against AAA games and their companies, much like what DLC Quest was. Except, you will not enjoy the actual "Game" that is offered; you will instead be continuously opening loot boxes. And for what? A sense of "Pride and Accomplishment"? There is no reason this game is 'good' other than that it's pure genius at poking fun at recent AAA releases. Very well done, MES.

[h1]Long Review:[/h1]
This game is a satirical parody of AAA games and their methods (in this case, the new "loot box" craze) to try and squeeze more money out of player's pockets. The execution of this game is perfect; you WILL spend more time opening boxes than playing the "Game". The "Game" itself is garbage. You'll play the first level maybe 10 times and by the end stages you're only playing the next tier once just to see what's changed. The only reason to 'play' is so you can open the next tier of loot boxes, so you can then try and get lucky, and then get more coins so you can open the next tier. That's it. That's all this game is. It represents how evermore, games are integrating excuses to gamble, to the point where the gambling aspect is of a higher quality than the game itself. Once again, bravo MES. This game is parody gold.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
 - Runs on anything, probably even your phone (oooh, how about an iOS or Android port?)
 - The level of your account is equal to the amount of loot boxes you have opened and is irrespective of the "Game" itself; a very clever "screw you" to the future of gaming.
 - Less than a dollar for a couple of giggles, as well as a powerful and daunting insight into the future of the video game industry.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
 - Less than an hour of playtime to reach the final "stage".

[h1]Suggestions:[/h1]
 - Add the option for multiple save games, as well as a difficulty setting, which allows the following tiers:
   - "Owner" - Easy
   - "Sponsored" - Medium
   - "Lucky" - Hard
   - "Realistic" - Very Hard
  - The only difference between all of these difficulties is the chance of the rarity of items dropping.

38270217.review:
I had this game gifted to me by a friend: and frankly, for a one dollar game... it's decent. There's no actual entry of credit card information as far as I can find, but it's definitely a very blunt parody. It definitely knows what it's looking at though, because it has all those bells and whistles that P2W games use on their lootboxes to keep you going.

That said: it's a dollar. You get what you pay for. Pay a dollar for a game, get a dollar worth of entertainment. Is the game anything special? Not really: but it does what it promises, it offers a quick laugh, and really it makes a decent gift: because honestly, my friend passed it to me without even saying a word about what it really was, and so when I opened it on up, I had little idea what to expect beyond the title and description. I gave it a shot, got a good laugh.

Don't expect a high replayability or a particularly exhilarating time. The devs are making active updates from what I've seen, so that's nice, and it's got achievements (though no cards as of yet).

In summation: it's a dollar, on release. It gives you exactly what a dollar game should. Nothing more, nothing less. Buy it for a friend as a joke, or if you're pretty wealthy just to say you did. If you're looking for an exciting game with replayability and hours of content: then save your dollars you're spending on dollar games for something more valuable. That's all that there is really to say.

38265815.review:
BattleFront 2の事件以降海外で高まっているLoot Box(いわゆるガチャ)への反感が産んだ、ただLoot Boxを開けるだけのゲーム。Loot Box Simulator 2017とでも言えばわかりやすいと思う。
ゲームの趣旨も中身も皮肉たっぷりで、開発者公認で「課金ガチャの馬鹿馬鹿しさを伝えるためのゲーム」となっている。
タイトルは和訳すると「これがギャンブルじゃないなんて信じられん」。

ゲームの流れとしては、コインを使ってLoot Boxを開け、Loot Boxの見た目を変えられるHatとSkinを獲得し、全種類のコンプリートを目指す。
コインはLoot Boxから出たHatとSkinを売るか、クジラがBattleFront 2のLoot Boxと外見が酷似した箱を集めまくるミニゲーム「Not BF2」をプレイする事で獲得出来る。
(ちなみにクジラはたびたびゲーム内に出てくるが、なぜクジラなのか気になった人は下記リンクを参照すると良い)
https://eigo-net-slang-jiten.blogspot.jp/2017/11/blog-post.html

Loot Boxには種類があり、見た目が豪華なLoot Boxほど必要なコイン量もどんどん高額になっていくため、ダブったHatやSkinを売ったりNot BF2をプレイしてコインを稼いで次のLoot Boxをアンロックしていくことになる。
そうしているうちは、どんどんコインの桁がインフレしていく様がクリッカー系ゲームのようで趣があるとか、Not BF2でせこせこ稼いだコインをガチャにつぎ込む姿が社会人廃課金ソシャゲプレイヤーに見えるだとか言って楽しめると思う。

しかし目的が全Loot BoxのアンロックからHatとSkinのコンプリートに移行すると、プレイ感が変わってくる。
ガチャで目的の品が出ないという苦しみに悩まされるというのはおそらく想像がつくだろうが、回す側の心境が違う。

というのも、HatとSkinが売れるというのは前述の通りだが、その売価が高すぎる。
仮に、ソシャゲで言うなら☆1にあたるコモンだけが出ても、全部売却すればガチャ代の80％は返還されてしまう。
☆4のエピックならたった一個で100％、☆5のレジェンダリーなら200％。あろうことかガチャを回してコインを儲けている。
HatとSkinもさほど種類が多くはないのですぐにダブりが出るようになり、Not BF2をプレイするまでもなくガチャでガチャ代をまかなえるようになる。

そんなわけで「コインを稼いでガチャる」というゲーム性を失い、無限のように回せるガチャと向き合っていると、どんどん苦痛と怒りが溜まってくる。
このいかにもカラー差分って感じのグラしたHatはなんだ、みたいなさっきまで気にしてなかったような事から、なんで出るアイテムがランダムなんだ、とかガチャ自体への全否定の気持ちさえも湧き上がる始末。

さっきまではハズレを引いても「これが本物の課金ガチャじゃなくてよかった」と思ってたのに、ハズレしか出ないLoot Boxを無感動にパカパカしていると「これが本物の課金ガチャだったら？」という見方になってくる。
もはやガチャを引いているという実感すらないので、ガチャという事柄から一歩引いた部外者の視点になっていく。

あまりの無意味っぷりに「こんな虚しい事があるなんて信じられん」って気持ちになって来て、次は「こんなのが実際にあるなんて信じられん」になる。
それがリアルマネーと射幸心を引き換えにする代物とあらば、「そんなのがギャンブルじゃないなんて信じられん」。というところまで行き着いた。

「仮想マネーでガチャ引くだけとかガチャ中毒には最高やんけ！」からスタートして、段階を踏んでガチャという物への見方が正常化出来ていくので、ガチャ中毒治療薬におすすめです。
好きなだけLoot Boxをパカパカ出来るので、ガチャ欲という痛み止めにもなるかもしれません。

38265315.review:
Surprisingly addictive and fun.  NOTE: You don't actually spend any real-life money in-game.  

The game is a satirical parody on the entire "loot box" culture that has pervaded our gaming culture in recent years.  The actual game is just opening loot boxes of varying tiers.  You start out with "actual trash" and work your way up the ladder to "Cardboard," "Presents," and so on.  Each loot box class has multiple "skins" and "hats" (of variying rarity: common, uncommon, rare, epic, and legendary) to alter the appearance of your boxes.  You obtain these cosmetics by opening the boxes with your in-game currency.  The goal is to collect all the hats and skins for each class of loot box. 

You obtain this in game currency by selling your duplicate items and by playing "Not BF 2" (a centipede clone within the game).  As you obtain more currency you unlock the higher tiers of loot boxes which in turn unlock harder levels of Not BF 2 which give you more currency per play. 

All in all, it's pretty simple. Overall I give it a 9/10.  Love the humor behind the project motivation and execution is done well.  BF 2 needs some work on hit detection but otherwise the game is pretty cute and amusing!

38262778.review:
[h1] What Is "I Can't Believe It's Not Gambling"? [/h1]

Informally, it's art. I believe, having played the game and unlocked all but a single achievement, that this game is artwork. In the same way that a novel or painting can be subversive, so too can a game. For those people looking for examples of artwork that only works within the video game medium, this is it.

But that's not what the game is about, or what you'll be doing. The game is a "loot box" simulator. Click a box, open it up and more boxes come out (or skins and hats). You'll take those crates, sell them for more crates. The game is designed to highlight an issue with modern gaming: the fact that many games these days feature a randomized system that encourages users to spend money. 

In addition to the crates, you'll need money. The game shows a sliding scale of more and more valuable crates and while you could gamble your way upwards (and I did, to see if it worked), you also can play a clone of Snake. Instead of eating apples, your whale will collect Overwatch and Battlefront II style lootboxes, as well as the letters in the word "Pride".


[h1] So how does it run? [/h1]

The game runs fine, even on moderate hardware. The graphics aren't anything to call home about, but they're varied enough with many skins over the boxes that it doesn't look too reptitive. Texture and sound quality are about what you'd expect from a game that costs a dollar.

Something I did appreciate, each crate that was opened was accompanied by a sound effect that varies by rarity. Getting an epic or legendary item comes with the sound of Whale calls and lesser boxes come with the sound of laughter. 


[h1] What about extras? [/h1]

Because the game doesn't feature Steam Cards, I feel that it maintains a sense of art. If the game had cards and a smaller variety of textures, I'd argue the game is trying to be greedy. The game does feature achievements, all which are something which requires effort to do, but are low enough effort a single play through should nab most of them.


[h1] Sense of Pride and Accomplishment [/h1]

The biggest takeaway, I felt, was that the Snake game and the minor amount of entertainment the game provided was well worth 1 dollar. If you're looking for a bit of "video game as artwork", the game has a message that you already likely know. Much like DLC Quest, the game isn't supposed to be taken seriously for very long. 

On the other hand, if you'd rather put that dollar towards an actual game, I wouldn't blame you. There isn't much to see here once you've seen it.

38248190.review:
このゲームは失敗作だ。






[url=jp.automaton.am/articles/newsjp/20171117-57844/]Automaton[/url]が書いた通り、 "I Can't Believe It's Not Gambling" はルート掘りという作業を抽象化し、それがいかに馬鹿馬鹿しいくだらないものであるかをプレイヤーに悟らせるためのゲームだ。

製作者の言葉の和訳を引用するなら、このゲームの意図は[i]「ギャンブルに昂ずる自分を客観視させることを目的として」おり[/i]、また[i]「このゲームを4時間以上遊んでいる人々は医者に診てもらった方がいい」[/i]ともコメントしている。

私はこのゲームがどんなものだろうかとずっと期待していた。2017年12月12日に発売され、日本時刻2017年12月12日11時57分に完全クリアして今レビューを書いている。

正直言って完全にがっかりさせられた。製作者はハック＆スラッシュの虚無さを表現することに失敗した。






遊んでいて割と普通に楽しいからだ。







--------2017/12/27追記--------
なんとこのゴミみたいなゲームに更なる要素追加パッチが当てられた。

その内容は、元々刺身の上にたんぽぽを乗せるような単純作業でアイテムを集めるだけのクソゲーに、クリスマス限定アイテムが追加されますよというもの。しかも全てのステージに8種ずつ。元々の「クリア」に必要なLegendaryアイテムが各ステージ4種である事を考えれば、作業時間が実に3倍に跳ね上がったということになる。

開発チームは本当に頭が湧いてるのだろうか。元から産業廃棄物の塊でしか無い、ゲームと呼ぶのすらおこがましいこのゴミにそんなパッチを当てて一体誰がプレイすると思ったのだろうか。








結論から言えばコンプリートした。むっちゃ楽しかった。この開発者にはつまらないゲームを作る才能が絶望的に無い。二度とゲームを作らないで欲しい。

这个游戏是我在偶然逛 首页商店即将推出专栏发现的，当时还没有解锁，好奇点进去看了下，咦？！这不是某某屁股开箱系统吗？仔细看了下宣传页面的视频和图片，可以确认这就是一个开箱模拟器，也可以称之为种族鉴定器，渍渍渍。（总有一些非酋妄想脱非入欧）在屁股里因为没有钱，没能好好的享受开箱系统，游戏体验极差，说不定在这里能有一个完美的开箱体验呢？索性加入了愿望单，这样解锁时方便邮件提醒我购买。

[h1] 氪不改命 玄不救非[/h1]


就在今天收到了邮件提醒居然开售了，屁颠屁颠的跑到商店一看，还挺便宜的，只需1刀，首发打折五元，用我在市场售卖的卡片余下的钱买下了这款开箱模拟器。付款下载，91.4M比我前面接的类似炸弹人的游戏还要大个40来M,这模拟器都有将近100M，那游戏却只有人家一半多，我对此感到质疑，我怕不是又被忽悠了。（炸弹人那游戏明天起来玩完再写。）首先进入游戏，两个ui选项，开始游戏和设置，先来看看设置，很简单的只有声音和音效调节以及窗口与全屏分辨率四个选项。点开分辨率发现这游戏不简单啊，居然支持2k分辨率，虽然我3A大作玩的少，但是普遍游戏基本最高都是1080p的，很少有支持2k的游戏，没想到这一个小小模拟器居然支持2k不简单。（虽然2k在这游戏也没什么卵用就是了）

[h1] 闲话说了辣么多，开始我们的偷渡之旅吧[/h1]

好家伙！这界面，简直跟屁股差不多嘛，右上角头像、名字、等级、金币，左上角则是皮肤选择收集，中间直接放着一个箱。。垃圾桶？！这是要我们从捡垃圾开始是吗?有意思，初始金币只有30块，但是等级居然有9999，你这是哪找的代练？给我也刷一个呗（雾👅）好了我们不要在意细节，下方中央有一个按钮，点击后就直接开箱。。。垃圾桶了，好吧还真是直截爽快，第一发蓝天白云，第二发还是蓝天白云，我就不说屎黄了，连紫内裤都不给我嘛？！一发10快，很快我的金币就归零了。然后我发现在游戏的左下角有一个绿色按钮，点进去就明白了，恐怕就是这游戏赚钱的方法了。一个很简陋的贪吃蛇，好吧毕竟这不是游戏的重点随便一点也是，玩家也不想吧多余的时间花在贪吃蛇上面。小赚了一笔回来继续开箱，开了几次总算出了一次金色传说，还可以挺漂亮的，很梦幻的感觉。如果出现重复的也不要灰心，点击sell，是可以出售的，而未拥有的则会提示你keep，将以收集保留解锁成就，没有收集控的玩家也可以在游戏左上角将以出售换成金币继续开箱，供玩家选择。每次开箱并定出4个皮肤，而收集类别分为头部和本体，只会出现两种部位的品级颜色，我们需要做的就是尽量保证每次能开到2绿2白以及更好的品级颜色，这样能保证我们每次开箱都不会亏，白色能卖2快绿色则是3块蓝色5块紫色10块金色20，这样我没卖出去还能继续开，如果出更好的重复物品卖出就是赚的，利滚利，就不用去玩那个蛋疼的小游戏了。（那个贪吃蛇在最后面很刁钻，简直没法玩，虽然每个箱子的小游戏金币都在倍增，但是还是很没营养）差不多就是积累金币，到达一定额度开另一种箱子以此类推，每种箱子都不一样。在游玩66分钟之后我终于开出了双黄蛋，可喜可贺。玩了两小时也就开出过3-4次双黄蛋，其他没怎么记录（个人数据仅供参考，也许我就是那个非酋/(ㄒoㄒ)/~~）

以上差不多就是该游戏的玩法，但是我现在要说的就是对游戏的建议以及想法。

作为屁股开箱模拟来说，开出的种类还是太少了，希望能加入头像，名片，场景壁纸之类的等等。这样多样性的存在随机性也会更大，才更有模拟实验的意义。还有那个睿智的贪吃蛇，实在是太刁钻人了，经常吧目标刷在墙里或者传送门中间附近，挨得十分近，容错率太低，这不是故意刁难人嘛。（还有我在龙珠那关的贪吃蛇分割两岸，不知道是游戏性质随机传送还是传送门传送错误，经常随机传送致死，很操蛋）再就是皮肤颜色未作改变，明明换了另一种箱子，但是颜色还是跟之前的皮肤相差无几，换汤不换药，这样少了很多新鲜感，很无趣，希望加入更多皮肤种类。还有最好能加入开箱记录以及数据统计，既然是往开箱模拟器走，当然做到更全面才能更受欢迎。
（暂时建议只想到了这些，后续我也不会补充，诶嘿😜我知道开发者是外国人，但是我不会英语啊，但就是想写出来，管他们看不看）

其实还可以吧这款游戏作为垫手和今日时运鉴定器，不仅仅是吧他作为屁股的开箱模拟器，其他游戏说不定也适用哟。小小测试一下自己今天适不适合开箱、开卡包之类的等等。或者是在开箱之前，来这里开几手，来垫一垫，这样又少花冤枉钱，又起到了心理安慰，何乐而不为呢。（请回到第一条蓝字）

最后我也是闲着蛋疼才会玩这款游戏并且写下这篇卵用没有的评测。（摆手╮(╯▽╰)╭）

39298320.review:
[h1] Every so often a game comes along that revolutionizes a genre or gaming as a whole. This is one of those games. [/h1]  

   With ICBING, there are no gimmicks, no bamboozles. No pre-order bonuses, no DLC, no map packs, nothing. Just a rich gaming experience. The moment you start the game you get right to it. You are greeted by your first challenge. The trashcan. All alone in a stunningly generated room with next gen graphics. From here the game changing design intuitively kicks in as you are greeted with a button. "Open Loot Box" After a few moments of taking in the beautifully generated trash can, I decide to take the plunge... I press the button. Upon the pressing of the button, the trashcan draws in closer and shakes... again... and once more as it erupts like a geyser. Emerging from this amazingly lifelike trash can is what can only be described as gifts from our one and only. Gaben. My rewards for embarking on the journey of clicking the button. To my amazement, it is equally beautifully generated additions for my trashcan. Different trash bags, trashcan lids, thrown out Trump protest signs. I can truly express my individuality through my very own unique and custom trashcan.  

   But there is a cost. A challenge. This experience of unending satisfaction, suspense, and joy is not free. There is an in-game currency system. Your first couple of loot boxes are on the house. After that, well... you're on the streets, kid. BUT WAIT! Worry not you, adventurous trashcan. This can easily be remedied. What if I told you that you don't even need a credit card? Or even your mother's credit card? What if I told you that you can earn more credits to continue this magnificent gaming experience by simply playing a game.... WITHIN this game? I know. Good thing I was sitting down because I was also astonished beyond belief. With one press of a button you are transported to an entirely new sector of the game. What sits in front of you is a whale. That's you. That gorgeous free creature is you. What is your goal you, trashcan and whale beast of a hybrid you ask? Your job is to consume all other opposing, interfering, ill-advised forms of microtransactions and in game currencies and assert your dominance. You can single handedly save the war on microtransactions by consuming them all. Again, there is a catch. Your fallen currency and micro-transaction foes follow you as you are now their lord and savior. They are your followers, and you are their leader. If you run into one of your followers, the ideals of your other followers collide and cause an implosion so vast that you as a whale simply cease to exist... and you have to start your journey to save the gaming community from microtransaction once again. Fear not for there is a light at the end of the tunnel. You win even when you lose. You are payed for your previous trials and endeavors as a graceful uniting whale. With that currency you just gained you can go back to the riveting experience of opening more loot boxes.  

   You might be thinking "All this for a trashcan?" Of course not, young Padawan! Once you master the trashcan, once you have seen all that is to be seen, collected all that is to be collected within this trashcan... more awaits. After you have triumphed over the trashcan, after you have made that trashcan a shining, gleaming, radiating representation of yourself, your next challenge is to master the Cardboard Box. I will say no more of the challenges that lay ahead of you. That is for you to discover on your own. 

   All this can be yours for a single dollar. One dollar is all it takes to unlock a world full of adventure and experiences that are all your own. You even have the ability to prestige and relive this phenomenal experience all over again. Compete in online leaderboards to have the bragging rights of the century. All for a single dollar. In today's day in age, you can't get much for a dollar. A wink and a hug from a scandalous lady behind your local McDonalds? A stale bag of knock-off gummy bears? A crappy fidget spinner from a fad that died long before your time? None can compare to the memories you will have with this game. All. For. A single. Dollar.  

The decision is [i] yours, [/i] Padawan.

39271309.review:
The Battle of Stalingrad (23 August 1942 – 2 February 1943) was a major confrontation of World War II in which Nazi Germany and its allies fought the Soviet Union for control of the city of Stalingrad (now Volgograd) in Southern Russia.

Marked by fierce close quarters combat and direct assaults on civilians in air raids, it is often regarded as one of the single largest (nearly 2.2 million personnel) and bloodiest (1.7–2 million killed, wounded or captured) battles in the history of warfare. It was an extremely costly defeat for German forces, and the Army High Command had to withdraw vast military forces from the West to replace their losses.

The German offensive to capture Stalingrad began in August 1942, using the 6th Army and elements of the 4th Panzer Army. The attack was supported by intensive Luftwaffe bombing that reduced much of the city to rubble. The fighting degenerated into house-to-house fighting; both sides poured reinforcements into the city. By mid-November 1942, the Germans had pushed the Soviet defenders back at great cost into narrow zones along the west bank of the Volga River.

On 19 November 1942, the Red Army launched Operation Uranus, a two-pronged attack targeting the weaker Romanian and Hungarian armies protecting the German 6th Army's flanks. The Axis forces on the flanks were overrun and the 6th Army was cut off and surrounded in the Stalingrad area. Adolf Hitler ordered that the army stay in Stalingrad and make no attempt to break out; instead, attempts were made to supply the army by air and to break the encirclement from the outside. Heavy fighting continued for another two months. By the beginning of February 1943, the Axis forces in Stalingrad had exhausted their ammunition and food. The remaining units of the 6th Army surrendered. The battle lasted five months, one week and three days.

적절한 확률보장과 깡을 진짜로 까는 듯한 이펙트와 함께 적절한 효과음을 들려주는 이 느낌이 정말 제대로 깡을 까는 듯한 느낌들 들게 만듭니다. 특히 깡을 까면 깔 수록 까는 맛을 더욱 돋보이게 하는 컬렉션들을 본다면 깡까는 재미와함께 컬렉션 모으는 재미도 있습니다. 

컬렉션 등급은 커먼 순으로 하여 언커먼 / 레어 / 에픽 / 레전더리 / 할리데이 순으로 컬렉션이 있습니다. 
특히 할리데이는 취향차가 있겠지만 정말 휘황찬란하기 때문에 이런거 좋아하시는 분이라면 모든 걸 깡 확률에 몸을 담구시면 됩니다. 

마지막으로 이 게임은 1100원으로 느끼는 깡까기 게임입니다. 옵치에서 느낀 젓 같은 깡 확률에 질리신 분이거나 깡에 모든 걸 담고싶은 분이시라면 정말 강추하는 게임입니다. 다만 단점이라면 업적으로 10만 번 깡이 존재하는데 이건 정말 하루종일 오토마우스 돌려야 하는 거 아니면 한번씩 깡까기 전 운빨 확인용으로 한번씩 까는 것 아닌 이상 깨기 쉽진 않을 것 같습니다. 

이상으로 1100원에 혜자 깡까기에 얼른 도전해보시기를 바랍니다!

39504473.review:
[h1]쓰레기를 까서 더 좋은 쓰레기를 얻자.[/h1]

우선 이 게임은 쓰레기를 열어 더 좋은 쓰레기를 얻고 그걸 팔아 또다른 쓰레기를 까서 더 좋은 쓰레기를 얻으며 더 나아가 종이박스, 나무상자, 선물상자, 우주선, 드래곤ball, 보물상자등이 있으며 같은 방식입니다.

이 게임이 대단한 이유는 이런 도박성 게임이 가지고 있는 특성을 잘 알고있다는 점입니다.
쓰레기를 까면 좋은 쓰레기가 나올때가 있고 그렇지 않은 쓰레기가 나올때가 있으며 그냥 그런 쓰레기가 나올 수도 있습니다. 
 우리의 목적은 언제까지나 더 많은 돈을 모으는 것. 
좋은 쓰레기가 나오면 기분이 좋다. 돈이 쌓이니 더 많이 뽑을 수 있으니까 하지만 그 다음에 안좋은 쓰레기가 나와 손해를 본다. 하지만 괜찮다. 아직 남은 돈이 있으니 허나 계속해서 안좋은 쓰레기가 나와 다시 본전이 되었다. 마지막으로 한번더 뽑았다. 좋은 쓰레기가 나왔다.
이걸로 다시 뽑지만 또다시 안좋은 쓰레기의 향연..

[b]만약 이 게임이 이런식의 무한 반복이었다면 이 게임은 시나리오 쓰다가 나가 떨어져버린 아귀의 손가락처럼 우리들의 관심밖으로 나가 떨어졌을겁니다.[/b]

허나 이 게임에는 우선 좋은 쓰레기가 잘 나오며 'keep'때문에 돈이 없어졌을떄를 대비, 상자깡 말고도 미니게임을 통해 돈을 벌 수있는 시스템을 도입하였습니다.[strike]미니게임이 더 재밌..[/strike] 덕분에 보물상자까지 빠르게 갈수있습니다.


또한, 게임 모으는 게임 스팀 유저들의 수집욕, 도전과제욕을 자극하는 콜렉션이 있으나 마지막 남은 도전과제가 10만번 뽑기라서 97%에서 포기. 한쪽은 유튜브, 한쪽은 게임...도전과제를 하다보니 이게 뭐하는 짓인가 자괴감이 드는 점도 맘에 들었습니다.
 게다가 이 게임은 아니, 정확하게는 이런류의 게임이 주는 공통적인 교훈이 있죠.
[i]"아무리 좋은 쓰레기를 뽑아봐야 결국 그건 쓰레기일 뿐이다."[/i]

최대할인율 1%(!?)저는 원가에 샀네요..흠..제점수는요...
[b]1100원으로 상자깡 기분내기는 좋은데..이걸 굳이 해야하나?[/b]
